Articles.Content:
In KSP 1, the achievements you can get usually have some witty name/pun/reference, like "Kerboy BeBop" (land on Bop). What ideas do you all have for achievement names in KSP 2? Here are some I came up with:

-Cooper: Play the game for 35 hours

-The Watcher: Enter orbit of Puf

-Cannot, Will Not, Must Not Interfere: Land on Puf

-Never Tell Me The Odds: Fly through a planetary ring with no collisions

-Debstep: Visit the DebDeb system

-Toasty: Enter orbit of Charr

-Carbonized: Land on Charr

-Here Am I Floating In My Tin Can: Send a Kerbal to High Kerbin Orbit

-Trees!: Enter orbit of Lapat (not an officially revealed planet, was briefly shown in a feature video)

-Lapat Yourself On The Back: Land on Lapat

What criteria should an achievement be based on? Should there be one for every body? 

-“No, it’s necessary”: land on skoot

-Trebuchet enthusiast: launch from skoot’s equatorial mountain

-Polar Express: get into polar orbit of a star

-Gloomy: descend into the depths of Glumo

-Pancake crawler: use a rover on Ovin

-Warp factor 9: reach 0.9c

-Sticks and sparks: unlock the torch drive

-Orbital bombardement: orbit Gurdamma

-Cloudy with a chance of meteor: land on Gurdamma

-One-day shipping: complete a supply route to the Mun

-Postal delays: complete an interstellar supply route

-Too many Gs: set up an interstellar communication link

it wouldnt really work to only have achivements on some planets. and it would be annoying to make an achivement for each planet. rather i think it would be better to have an achivement for landing on all planets or doing a big milestone.(reaching orbit,orbit the sun,plant flag on the moon,land on another planet, go to another solar system, land on a planet on another solar system and also things with colonies.)

21 hours ago, t_v said:

What criteria should an achievement be based on? Should there be one for every body? 

I was figuring that there would be one achievement for orbiting a body, and one for landing (if applicable), plus whatever extras.

11 hours ago, jastrone said:

it wouldnt really work to only have achivements on some planets. and it would be annoying to make an achivement for each planet. rather i think it would be better to have an achivement for landing on all planets or doing a big milestone.

Fair point. The system I was envisioning works in KSP 1, but in KSP 2, where there will be many more planets... yeah, it might get tedious. Relegating achievements to larger milestones/specific challenges isn't a bad idea. Then again, you'll probably visit most of those planets as you play the game anyway, so maybe it still works?

A few more I came up with:

Perfectly Balanced: Reach the Lagrange point between Rask and Rusk

I Was Lost, But Now I Live Here: Set up a colony anywhere

Open The Pod Bay Doors: Design a spacecraft that uses the Kal-1000 Controller

Fly, You Fools: Fly from Rask to Rusk or vice versa in *short amount of time* (achievable only by launching straight up when the other one is overhead)

My suggestions are a bit less ambitious than others have been, but I suspect a good number of achievements will be for the early game.

Point correct end towards space: Complete the first tutorial.

Spaaaaaaaace: Reach space.

Half way to anywhere: Reach Kerbin orbit.

What goes up...: Return from Kerbin orbit and recover the craft.

Good landing: Bring a Kerbal back safely from atmospheric flight.

Great landing: Bring a Kerbal back safely from Kerbin orbit.

Oh the kermanity!: Lose a Kerbal.

Dear Mun: Fly by the Mun.

Scanning for cheese: Orbit the Mun.

One Small (Mis-)Step: Land a Kerbal on the Mun.

Ooh, shiny: Fly by Minmus.

What an Achieve-mint: Orbit Minmus.

This is definitely not edible!: Land on Minmus. (Because Minmus is apparently going to be made of glass in KSP2...)

Home sweet home: Build your first colony.

Not that kind of boom, Jeb!: Trigger a boom event for a colony.

Are those potatoes?: Build a colony on Duna.

404 Not Found: Land on Dres.

Jool's jewels: Land on all of Jool's moons.

HOW!?!?: Return home from the surface of Eve.

The. What.: Land on the surface of Jool.

I can't even...: Land on the surface of the Sun (Kerbol).

Star player: Reach another solar system.
"The planets are rad" needs to be included in some form or fashion.

1 hour ago, TheOrbitalMechanic said:

I Was Lost, But Now I Live Here: Set up a colony anywhere

This should be for setting up an colony on Eve before you have the MH engines.

16 hours ago, TLTay said:

"The planets are rad": set up a uranium mine

-Dancing in the rain: (if there is weather in the game) fly through a gas giant hurricane

-A hop, a skip, and a jump: jump into orbit on Gilly (just EVA)

-Kerbal Submarine Program: investigate the oceans of 7 watery planets (reach the bottom at a deep point)

-No place like Centrifuge: have kerbals be indefinitely happy with a centrifuge

-Full ballast: pack enough Snacks for a century (or decade?)

Mutually Assured Destruction: land with an Orion Drive

Edited December 15, 2021 by t_v
Leaf on the Wind - first time landing on Eve

New Horizons : Enter SOI of Eeloo

All these worlds are yours : Colony everywhere.

Is that you, Matt?: Make an SSTO

Kaboom? : Make orion drive

Yes Rico, Kaboom. : Eject 1000 bombs from Orion Drive

Slippy! : Land on any ice cap

MOAR BOOSTERS : 2 or more of each booster on a rocket.

Looks like home. : Enter SOI of Laythe

Jolly Green Giant : Enter SOI of Jool

Jumping Jet! : Make VTOL

SpaceX : Recover all parts of a rocket.

Stagnation : Don't unlock any parts for 5 years.

Caveman : Land anywhere but kerbin without any facility upgrades.

Magellan : Circumnavigate Kerbin by sea.

Gurdammit: Crash on Gurdamma

In Thrust We Trust: Launch a rocket using every engine in the game

Bonk: Land on Donk

Watney Kerman: Have a colony inhabited by a single Kerbal

1 hour ago, TheOrbitalMechanic said:

Watney Kerman: Have a colony inhabited by a single Kerbal

Really like that last one. Maybe have it be on Duna?

On 12/15/2021 at 7:27 PM, Admiral Fluffy said:

Really like that last one. Maybe have it be on Duna?

Land on Duna with 6 Kerbals on board, and raise the same ship to orbit with only 5 present.  Something like that.

On the topic of achievements, I hope all of the more special ones are hidden by default on steam.

Not the ugliest place to be stranded: Have at least one kerbal on Eve for a year.

Leg day: Eva on Ovin.

Rock ‘n roll: Use a rover arm to scan a rock.

Great Scott!: Complete a tutorial.

Permission to come aboard: Dock for the first time.

Home sweet home: Recover crew for the first time.

F9! F9! F9!: Crash for the first time.

One small stumble: First eva on the Mun.

Stretch your legs: Do your first eva.

Ignition: Light your first engine. 

Are we there yet?: First time warp.

Where to next?: Land on every celestial body. (Not in a single mission.)

It’s a trap! : Land on Eve.

Or maybe land on Eve and fail at ascent.

Wernher Would Be Proud: Watch every tutorial

Slingshotting: Flyby every body in the Kerbol system with a methalox rocket--no docking or refueling

Driving With The Top Down: Fly a crewed spacecraft with only external command seats

Looks wonky:Preform a slingshot maneuver
 

 


 

That’s really all I came up with.

Multiplanetary Species: Land Kerbals on Duna for the first time.

Generation Ship: Send a craft with 100 or more Kerbals to another star system.

Kerbin 2.0: Visit Laythe for the first time.

Jeff Who? Build a rocket in the VAB but don’t launch it for at least 5 ingame years.

Elon Would Be Proud: Land 100 rocket stages back at the KSC

A PR nightmare: lose 1000 rep (if that even exist)/K.I.A a kerbal
Grand oh no: K.I.A 100 kerbals

Edited January 6, 2022 by ffx
Gotta make it family freindly

Hey! This wasn't part of the plan!

(Download a Mod)

Battle of the Kerbals - Land near lava (or on both rask and rusk)

Successful Failure - Crash on a planet and plant a flag

Edited January 6, 2022 by BekfastDerp13
more ideas
Thats no moon. - Make a space station.

What's a Tree Octopus?

-Discover the Kraken on Bop.

1 hour ago, Admiral Fluffy said:

Thats no moon. - Make a space station.

Make an orbiting colony (I’m assuming these will be larger than standard space stations)

1 hour ago, Admiral Fluffy said:

Thats no moon. - Make a space station.

3 minutes ago, t_v said:

Make an orbiting colony (I’m assuming these will be larger than standard space stations)

Make a colony on a large asteroid?
